title: Ark.Alliance.Portfolio
description: Production-grade portfolio CMS and static site generator with AI-powered content creation. Features 20 TypeORM entities, multi-provider AI integration (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini), one-click static export, MVVM architecture, 235+ passing tests, and comprehensive admin dashboard. Built with React 18, TypeScript 5, Express, and TypeORM with end-to-end type safety.

features.title: 20-Entity Content Management System
features.description: Comprehensive CMS with TypeORM entities for Profile, Projects (with multi-page documentation), Experiences, Education, Skills, Media Assets, Carousel, Widgets, and more. Full CRUD operations through an intuitive admin dashboard.

features.title: Multi-Provider AI Integration
features.description: Native integration with OpenAI GPT-4, Anthropic Claude 3, and Google Gemini. AES-256 encrypted API key storage, intelligent content generation, summarization, and professional writing enhancement for all CMS entities.

features.title: One-Click Static Site Export
features.description: Transform your portfolio CMS into a deployable static website with a single click. Generates optimized HTML/CSS/JS bundles ready for GitHub Pages, Netlify, Vercel, or any CDN with zero server costs.

features.title: Clean Three-Tier Architecture
features.description: Enterprise-grade separation with Presentation (React MVVM), Shared Contracts (TypeScript DTOs), and Application (Express + TypeORM) layers. Repository pattern, type-safe APIs, and comprehensive error handling throughout.

features.title: Production-Grade Security
features.description: JWT authentication with bcrypt password hashing (12 rounds), Helmet security headers, CORS protection, rate limiting, and AES-256 encryption for sensitive credentials. Built for deployment from day one.

features.title: Dynamic Theme System
features.description: Runtime theme switching with no page reload. Built-in Architectural and Aloe Vera themes, plus JSON-based custom theme creation. CSS variable injection enables instant visual transformations.

pages.title: Overview
pages.content:
## Ark.Alliance.Portfolio

**Production-Grade Portfolio CMS & Static Site Generator**

A comprehensive portfolio platform that goes beyond simple showcases. It combines enterprise-grade software practices with AI-powered content generation, full content management capabilities, and one-click static site deployment.

### Perfect For

- üíº **Professionals** ‚Äî Showcase work experience and projects with dynamic CMS
- üéì **Academics** ‚Äî Document research, publications, and teaching
- üé® **Creatives** ‚Äî Present portfolio work with rich media management
- üíª **Engineers** ‚Äî Demonstrate technical projects with multi-page documentation
- üè¢ **Agencies** ‚Äî Manage team portfolios with collaborative features

### Core Capabilities

| Capability | Description |
|------------|-------------|
| **Content Management** | 20 TypeORM entities covering all portfolio aspects |
| **AI Content Creation** | Multi-provider AI (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini) |
| **Static Site Export** | One-click deployment to any static host |
| **Multi-Page Projects** | Rich documentation with Markdown + Mermaid |
| **Dynamic Theming** | Runtime theme switching, no reload required |
| **Media Management** | Upload, organize, and optimize assets |
| **Type Safety** | End-to-end TypeScript with shared DTOs |
| **Security** | JWT auth, bcrypt, AES-256, Helmet headers |

### Technology Stack

**Frontend**
- React 18 with TypeScript 5.x
- Vite build tool
- MVVM component architecture
- React Router for navigation
- Axios for API communication

**Backend**
- Node.js 18+ with Express
- TypeORM for data access
- SQLite (dev) / PostgreSQL (prod)
- 16 business services
- 9 API controllers

**Shared**
- TypeScript DTOs
- Shared enumerations
- Type-safe contracts

**AI Integration**
- OpenAI GPT-4 & GPT-4 Turbo
- Anthropic Claude 3 (Opus, Sonnet, Haiku)
- Google Gemini 1.5 (Pro, Flash)

### Key Statistics

- **20** TypeORM Entities
- **16** Backend Services  
- **9** API Controllers
- **235+** Test Cases (100% pass rate)
- **3** Architecture Layers
- **3** AI Providers

### Quick Start

```bash
# Install shared library
cd Ark.Portfolio.Share
npm install && npm run build

# Start backend (port 3085)
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.Backend
npm install && npm run dev

# Start frontend (port 3080)
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.UI
npm install && npm run dev
```

**Default admin credentials**: `admin` / `admin123`

### Entity Relationship Model ```mermaid erDiagram PROFILE ||--o{ USER : "manages" PROFILE { uuid id PK string name string title string summary string email string phone string location } USER ||--o{ PROJECT : "creates" USER { uuid id PK string username UK string password string role } PROJECT ||--|{ PROJECT_PAGE : "contains" PROJECT ||--|{ PROJECT_FEATURE : "has" PROJECT ||--|{ PROJECT_TECHNOLOGY : "uses" PROJECT { uuid id PK string title string description string status string imageUrl string repoUrl string demoUrl } PROJECT_PAGE { uuid id PK string title string type text content int navOrder } PROJECT_FEATURE { uuid id PK string title text description string icon } TECHNOLOGY ||--|{ PROJECT_TECHNOLOGY : "links" TECHNOLOGY { uuid id PK string name UK string category string icon } EXPERIENCE ||--|{ SKILL : "requires" EXPERIENCE { uuid id PK string company string role string description date startDate date endDate } EDUCATION { uuid id PK string institution string degree string field date graduationDate } SKILL ||--|| SKILL_CATEGORY : "belongsTo" SKILL { uuid id PK string name int proficiency int yearsOfExperience } SKILL_CATEGORY { uuid id PK string name UK string description int displayOrder } MEDIA { uuid id PK string filename string mimetype string url string category int fileSize } CAROUSEL_ITEM { uuid id PK string title string subtitle string imageUrl string linkUrl int order boolean isActive } AI_SETTINGS { uuid id PK string provider string model string encryptedApiKey json config } STYLE_CONFIG { uuid id PK string themeName UK json colorPalette json typography boolean isActive } ``` ### Service Architecture **Backend Services (16 total)** | Service | Responsibility | Lines of Code | |---------|----------------|---------------| | `ProfileService` | Profile CRUD operations | ~180 | | `ProjectService` | Project management | ~320 | | `ExperienceService` | Work history | ~200 | | `EducationService` | Academic background | ~180 | | `SkillService` | Skill management | ~220 | | `MediaService` | Asset upload & management | ~280 | | `AiService` | Multi-provider AI integration | ~450 | | `ExportService` | Static site generation | ~650 | | `AuthService` | JWT authentication | ~240 | | `CarouselService` | Homepage carousel | ~160 | | `StyleConfigService` | Theme management | ~190 | | ...and 5 more | Additional features | ~800 | **API Controllers (9 total)** - Public: Profile, Projects, Resume, Carousel - Admin: All entity CRUD, Media Upload, Static Export, AI Generation ### Admin Dashboard ![Admin Dashboard Overview](/Assets/Projects/Ark.Portfolio/Admin_Dashobard.PNG) *Comprehensive admin interface for managing all portfolio content*

pages.title: Features & Use Cases
pages.content:
## Functional Use Cases

### 1. Portfolio Content Management

**Scenario**: Professional wants to maintain a dynamic portfolio with CMS

**Workflow**:
1. Admin logs in with JWT authentication
2. Navigate to Admin Dashboard
3. Create/update profile information (name, title, summary, contact)
4. Add work experiences with:
   - Company, role, dates
   - Detailed descriptions
   - Technology tags
5. Create projects with:
   - Title, description, status
   - Repository and demo URLs
   - Hero images
6. Add multi-page project documentation
7. Upload media assets (images, PDFs, videos)
8. Configure homepage carousel
9. Publish changes (live update)

**Benefits**:
- ‚úÖ Centralized content management
- ‚úÖ Version control through database
- ‚úÖ Type-safe data structures
- ‚úÖ Real-time preview
- ‚úÖ No code deployments needed

![Projects Management](/Assets/Projects/Ark.Portfolio/Admin_Projects.PNG)

*Manage projects with full CRUD operations and multi-page documentation*

---

### 2. AI-Assisted Content Generation

**Scenario**: User needs professional content for project descriptions

**Workflow**:
1. Navigate to **AI Settings** in admin panel
2. Configure AI provider:
   - Choose: OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini
   - Select model (GPT-4, Claude 3 Opus, Gemini 1.5 Pro)
   - Enter API key (encrypted with AES-256)
3. Select content entity (Project, Experience, Skill, etc.)
4. Write prompt or select template:
   - "Generate a professional project summary"
   - "Create compelling feature descriptions"
   - "Write technical documentation"
5. Review AI-generated content
6. Edit and refine as needed
7. Save to entity

**Supported Operations**:
- üìù Content generation from prompts
- üìÑ Text summarization
- ‚ú® Professional writing enhancement
- üìö Technical documentation assistance
- üéØ SEO optimization suggestions

**AI Provider Comparison**:

| Provider | Best For | Models Available |
|----------|----------|------------------|
| OpenAI | General purpose, code | GPT-4, GPT-4 Turbo |
| Anthropic | Long-form content, analysis | Claude 3 Opus, Sonnet, Haiku |
| Google Gemini | Multi-modal, structured data | Gemini 1.5 Pro, Flash |

---

### 3. Static Website Deployment

**Scenario**: Deploy portfolio to static hosting (zero server costs)

**Workflow**:
1. Populate all CMS content (profile, projects, experiences)
2. Configure visual theme (Architectural or Aloe Vera)
3. Navigate to **Export** ‚Üí **Static Site** in admin
4. Click **"Generate Static Website"**
5. System processes:
   - Renders all React components to HTML
   - Bundles CSS with theme variables
   - Optimizes JavaScript bundle
   - Copies media assets
   - Generates sitemap.xml
   - Creates SEO meta tags
6. Download ZIP file (typically 5-15 MB)
7. Extract and deploy to:
   - **GitHub Pages**: Push to `gh-pages` branch
   - **Netlify**: Drag-drop ZIP or connect repo
   - **Vercel**: Import from GitHub
   - **AWS S3 + CloudFront**: Upload to S3 bucket

**Advantages**:
- üí∞ Zero server costs
- üöÄ Infinite scalability via CDN
- ‚ö° Fast loading times (static assets)
- üîí Maximum security (no backend to attack)
- üåç Global CDN distribution
- üì± Mobile-optimized responsive design

**Generated Structure**:
```
static-export.zip
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ projects.html
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resume.html
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ sitemap.xml
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ robots.txt
```

---

### 4. Dynamic Theming System

**Scenario**: Customize portfolio appearance without code changes

**Workflow**:
1. Access **StyleConfig** in admin panel
2. Choose from built-in themes:
   - **Architectural**: Clean, minimalist, structural aesthetic
   - **Aloe Vera**: Organic, nature-inspired, warm tones
3. Or create custom theme with JSON:
   ```json
   {
     "colorPalette": {
       "primary": "#3B82F6",
       "secondary": "#8B5CF6",
       "accent": "#F59E0B"
     },
     "typography": {
       "fontFamily": "Inter, sans-serif",
       "headingWeight": 700
     }
   }
   ```
4. Click **"Apply Theme"** (instant, no reload)
5. Preview changes across all pages
6. Save configuration to database
7. Theme persists across user sessions

**Configuration Options**:
- üé® Color palettes (primary, secondary, accent, backgrounds)
- üî§ Typography (fonts, sizes, weights, line heights)
- üìè Spacing and padding
- üñºÔ∏è Border styles and radius
- üåà Gradient definitions
- üé≠ Component-specific overrides

![Hero Carousel Management](/Assets/Projects/Ark.Portfolio/Admin_Hero_Carrousel.PNG)

*Configure homepage carousel with dynamic theming*

---

### 5. Multi-Page Project Documentation

**Scenario**: Create comprehensive technical documentation for projects

**Workflow**:
1. Create or edit **Project** entity
2. Navigate to **Project Pages** tab
3. Add pages with specific types:
   - **OVERVIEW**: Project summary, quick start
   - **FUNCTIONAL**: Feature specifications, use cases
   - **TECHNICAL**: Implementation details, API docs
   - **ARCHITECTURE**: System diagrams (Mermaid support)
   - **ROADMAP**: Future plans, milestones
4. Write content in Markdown:
   - Headers, lists, tables
   - Code blocks with syntax highlighting
   - **Mermaid diagrams** for architecture
   - Links and images
5. Set navigation order (drag-and-drop)
6. Preview rendered output
7. Publish (available immediately)

**Benefits**:
- üìñ Professional documentation structure
- üîÑ Version controlled in database
- üîç Searchable content
- üé® Rich formatting with Markdown
- üìä Visual diagrams with Mermaid
- üîó Deep linking to specific sections

![Resume/Experience Management](/Assets/Projects/Ark.Portfolio/Admin_ResumeManager.PNG)

*Manage professional experience with timeline visualization*

---

### 6. Media Asset Management

**Scenario**: Organize and optimize portfolio media

**Workflow**:
1. Navigate to **Media** in admin panel
2. Upload files:
   - Images: PNG, JPG, WebP (auto-optimization)
   - Documents: PDF, DOCX
   - Videos: MP4, WebM
3. Organize with:
   - Categories (Projects, Experiences, General)
   - Tags for searchability
   - Descriptions and alt text
4. System processes:
   - Thumbnail generation
   - Image optimization
   - CDN-ready URLs
5. Use media in projects, experiences, or carousel
6. Track usage and file sizes

**Supported Operations**:
- üì§ Upload (single or batch)
- üóÇÔ∏è Categorize and tag
- üîç Search and filter
- üñºÔ∏è Preview and edit metadata
- üóëÔ∏è Delete with orphan detection
- üìä Storage analytics

pages.title: Deployment & Integration
pages.content:
## Deployment

### Prerequisites

- Node.js >= 18.0.0
- npm >= 9.0.0
- Git for version control

### Development Setup

```bash
# 1. Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/M2H-Machine-to-Human-Race/Ark.Alliance.Portfolio.git
cd Ark.Alliance.Portfolio

# 2. Install and build Shared Library (REQUIRED FIRST)
cd Ark.Portfolio.Share
npm install
npm run build

# 3. Install and start Backend
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.Backend
npm install
npm run dev
# Backend runs on https://localhost:3085

# 4. In new terminal - Install and start Frontend
cd Ark.Portfolio.UI
npm install
npm run dev
# Frontend runs on http://localhost:3080
```

### Production Build

```bash
# Build all layers
cd Ark.Portfolio.Share && npm run build
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.Backend && npm run build
cd ../Ark.Portfolio.UI && npm run build
```

### Environment Variables

**Backend** (`Ark.Portfolio.Backend/.env`):
```env
# Server Configuration
PORT=3085
NODE_ENV=development

# Database
DATABASE_TYPE=sqlite
DATABASE_NAME=portfolio.db

# Authentication
JWT_SECRET=your-super-secret-jwt-key
JWT_EXPIRES_IN=24h

# AI Services (encrypted in production)
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...
GOOGLE_AI_API_KEY=...

# CORS
CORS_ORIGIN=http://localhost:3080
```

**Frontend** (`Ark.Portfolio.UI/.env`):
```env
# API Configuration
VITE_API_URL=https://localhost:3085/api
VITE_USE_MOCK_DATA=false

# Feature Flags
VITE_ENABLE_AI_FEATURES=true
VITE_ENABLE_STATIC_EXPORT=true
```

---

## Testing

### Running Tests

```bash
cd Ark.Portfolio.Tests
npm install

# Run all tests
npm test

# With coverage report
npm run test:coverage
```

**Test Statistics**: 235+ tests with 100% pass rate using Jest and React Testing Library.

---

## CI/CD Pipeline

### GitHub Actions Workflow

Triggered on:
- **Push** to `main` or `develop` branches
- **Pull Requests** targeting `main` or `develop`

**Workflow Steps**:
1. ‚úÖ Build Shared Library
2. ‚úÖ Build Backend
3. ‚úÖ Build Frontend
4. ‚úÖ Run Test Suite (235+ tests)

**Branch Protection**:

| Branch | Protection Rules |
|--------|-----------------|
| `main` | Requires PR approval, passing CI, no force push |
| `develop` | Requires passing CI |

---

## Security

### Security Features

- üîê **JWT Authentication**: Token-based auth with bcrypt hashing
- üõ°Ô∏è **Helmet Headers**: Security headers for all responses
- üîë **Encrypted Storage**: AES-256 encryption for AI API keys
- üö´ **CORS Protection**: Configurable allowed origins
- üîí **Input Validation**: Class-validator and sanitization
- üìä **Rate Limiting**: Prevent abuse and DoS attacks

### Reporting Vulnerabilities

For security concerns, review [SECURITY.md](https://github.com/M2H-Machine-to-Human-Race/Ark.Alliance.Portfolio/blob/main/SECURITY.md) or email: security@ark-alliance.io

---

## Static Site Export

### Export Process

1. Log in to Admin Dashboard
2. Navigate to **Export** ‚Üí **Static Site**
3. Click **Generate Static Website**
4. Download ZIP file (5-15 MB)
5. Deploy to:
   - **GitHub Pages**: Push to `gh-pages` branch
   - **Netlify**: Drag-drop or connect repo
   - **Vercel**: Import from GitHub
   - **AWS S3**: Upload to bucket

### Output Structure

```
static-export.zip
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.html          # Homepage
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ projects.html       # Projects catalog
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resume.html         # Professional resume
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images/         # Optimized images
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ css/            # Bundled styles
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ js/             # Minified JavaScript
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ sitemap.xml         # SEO sitemap
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ robots.txt          # Crawler instructions
```

---

## Contributing

We welcome contributions! Please read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/M2H-Machine-to-Human-Race/Ark.Alliance.Portfolio/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines.

### Quick Guide

1. Fork the repository
2. Create feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature`)
3. Commit changes (`git commit -m 'Add amazing feature'`)
4. Push to branch (`git push origin feature/amazing-feature`)
5. Open Pull Request

---
